message.content:
cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.CL, cs.CR, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with a probabilistic model for detecting conflicts between arguments given sentiments regarding their acceptability. This involves both direct and inverse problems in abstract argumentation, which are related to artificial intelligence and machine learning (cs.AI) and probabilistic modeling (cs.LG). The paper also discusses natural language processing (cs.CL) and security and privacy (cs.CR) implications of the model. Finally, the paper contributes to knowledge acquisition (cs.SI) by providing a data-driven approach to acceptability semantics.
